Ballyvaughan is located on the N67 and can be reached by car or by a bus service from Limerick or Galway. Travellers using public transport from Dublin can travel to either Galway or Limerick and take

Travellers using public transport from Shannon can take the bus from Limerick and change in Ennis for the Lisdoonvarna bus which is 10 miles away from Ballyvaughan.  The best option is to continue to Galway from Shannon and there connect with the Doolin bus which passes through Ballyvaughan.

The village itself is very small and so no transport is needed. However, one of the main attractions of Ballyvaughan is its location in the Burren, and transport (car or bicycle) is essential to enjoy this unique landscape fully.
